get.description: This endpoint allows you to get a list of products. Products are paginated and they can be filtered. In the Enterprise Edition, since the 2.0, permissions based on your user groups are applied to the set of products you request.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter products, for more details see the Filters section

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Filter product values to return scopable attributes for the given channel as well as the non localizable/non scopable attributes, for more details see the Filter product values via channel section

parameters.name: locales
parameters.description: Filter product values to return localizable attributes for the given locales as well as the non localizable/non scopable attributes, for more details see the Filter product values via locale section

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Filter product values to only return those concerning the given attributes, for more details see the Filter on product values section

parameters.name: pagination_type
parameters.description: Pagination method type, see Pagination section

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

parameters.name: search_after
parameters.description: Cursor when using the `search_after` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results by page, see Pagination section

parameters.name: with_count
parameters.description: Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way

parameters.name: with_attribute_options
parameters.description: Return labels of attribute options in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version)

parameters.name: with_quality_scores
parameters.description: Return product quality scores in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version)

parameters.name: with_completenesses
parameters.description: Return product completenesses in the response. (Only available since the 6.0 version)

href.description: URI of the current page of resources
URI of the first page of resources
URI of the previous page of resources
URI of the next page of resources
URI of the resource

identifier.description: Product identifier, i.e. the value of the only `pim_catalog_identifier` attribute

family.description: Family code from which the product inherits its attributes and attributes requirements.
family.x-validation-rules: It is equal to an existing family code. In the case of variant product, the given family should be the same as the product model family.
family.default: null only in the case of a non variant product

categories.description: Codes of the categories in which the product is classified
categories.x-validation-rules: Each string of the array is equal to an existing category code

groups.description: Codes of the groups to which the product belong
groups.x-validation-rules: Each string of the array is equal to an existing group code

parent.description: Code of the parent product model when the product is a variant (only available since the 2.0). This parent can be modified since the 2.3.
parent.x-validation-rules: It is equal to an existing product model code only if the product is variant otherwise it's equal to null

values.description: Product attributes values, see Product values section for more details
values.x-validation-rules: Validation rules detailed in Product values section

data.description: Product value. See the `data` format section for more details.

linked_data.description: Object containing labels of attribute options (only available since the 5.0 and when query parameter "with_attribute_options" is set to "true"). See the `linked_data` format section for more details.

associations.description: Several associations related to groups, product models and/or other products, grouped by association types
associations.x-validation-rules:
• The `associationTypeCode` is the code of an existing association type. 
• Each string in the array of the property `groups` is the code of an existing group. 
• Each string in the array of the property `products` is the identifier of an existing product. 
• Each string in the array of the property `product_models` is the code of an existing product model.

groups.description: Array of groups codes with which the product is in relation

products.description: Array of product identifiers with which the product is in relation

product_models.description: Array of product model codes with which the product is in relation (only available since the v2.1)

quantified_associations.description: Several quantified associations related to products and/or product models, grouped by quantified association types (only available since the 5.0)
quantified_associations.x-validation-rules:
• The `quantifiedAssociationTypeCode` is the code of an existing association type which provides quantity information. 
• Each object in the array of the property `products` contains the identifier of an existing product and the quantity of it.

products.description: Array of objects containing product identifiers and quantities with which the product is in relation

product_models.description: Array of objects containing product model codes and quantities with which the product is in relation

metadata.description: More information around the product (only available since the v2.0 in the Enterprise Edition)

workflow_status.description: Status of the product regarding the user permissions

quality_scores.description: Product quality scores for each channel/locale combination (only available since the 5.0 and when the "with_quality_scores" query parameter is set to "true")

completenesses.description: Product completenesses for each channel/locale combination (only available since the 7.0 version, and when the "with_completenesses" query parameter is set to "true")

401.x-details: Can be caused by a missing or expired token

examples.message: Authentication is required

403.x-details: The user does not have the permission to execute this request

examples.message: Access forbidden. You are not allowed to list categories.

406.x-details: The `Accept` header is not `application/json` but it should

examples.message: ‘xxx’ in ‘Accept‘ header is not valid. Only ‘application/json‘ is allowed.

422.x-details: The validation of the entity given in the body of the request failed

examples.message: Property "labels" expects an array as data, "NULL" given. Check the API reference documentation.

patch.description: This endpoint allows you to update and/or create several products at once. Learn more about Update behavior. Note that if no product exists for the given identifier, it creates it. In the Enterprise Edition, since the v2.0, permissions based on your user groups are applied to the products you try to update. It may result in the creation of drafts if you only have edit rights through the product's categories.

get.description: This endpoint allows you to get a list of products. Products are paginated and they can be filtered. In the Enterprise Edition, permissions based on your user groups are applied to the set of products you request.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter products, for more details see the Filters section

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Filter product values to return scopable attributes for the given channel as well as the non localizable/non scopable attributes, for more details see the Filter product values via channel section

parameters.name: locales
parameters.description: Filter product values to return localizable attributes for the given locales as well as the non localizable/non scopable attributes, for more details see the Filter product values via locale section

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Filter product values to only return those concerning the given attributes, for more details see the Filter on product values section

parameters.name: pagination_type
parameters.description: Pagination method type, see Pagination section

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

parameters.name: search_after
parameters.description: Cursor when using the `search_after` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results by page, see Pagination section

parameters.name: with_count
parameters.description: Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way

parameters.name: with_attribute_options
parameters.description: Return labels of attribute options in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version)

parameters.name: with_quality_scores
parameters.description: Return product quality scores in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version)

parameters.name: with_completenesses
parameters.description: Return product completenesses in the response. (Only available since the 6.0 version)

get.description: This endpoint allows you to get a list of product models. Product models are paginated. In the Enterprise Edition, since the 2.0, permissions based on your user groups are applied to the set of products you request.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter product models, for more details see the Filters section

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Filter product values to return scopable attributes for the given channel as well as the non localizable/non scopable attributes, for more details see the Filter product values via channel section

parameters.name: locales
parameters.description: Filter product values to return localizable attributes for the given locales as well as the non localizable/non scopable attributes, for more details see the Filter product values via locale section

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Filter product values to only return those concerning the given attributes, for more details see the Filter on product values section and the Filter on product model properties section

parameters.name: pagination_type
parameters.description: Pagination method type, see Pagination section

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

parameters.name: search_after
parameters.description: Cursor when using the `search_after` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results by page, see Pagination section

parameters.name: with_count
parameters.description: Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way

parameters.name: with_quality_scores
parameters.description: Return product model quality scores in the response. (Only available since the 6.0 version)

axes.description: Codes of attributes used as variant axes
axes.x-validation-rules:
• Should be an array of maximum 5 existing attribute codes 
• These attributes should belong to the family of the family variant 
• Only the following attribute types are allowed: `simple select`, `multi select`, `reference data`, `metric`, `boolean` 
• Attributes cannot be scopable, nor localizable nor locale specific 
• Attributes used as axes in one level cannot be used as axes or as attributes in the other level

• These attributes should belong to the family of the family variant 
• Attributes used as attribute in one level cannot be used as axes or as attributes in the other level

get.summary: Get a product related to a catalog
get.description: This endpoint allows you to get a specific product related to a catalog. In the Enterprise Edition, permissions based on your app settings are applied on the product you request. Please, note that a disabled catalog can return an HTTP 200 with a payload containing an error message, for more details see the App Catalog section.
